duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide service desk support for end users and resolve support requests.
System administration for enterprise tools and platforms such as Microsoft Active Directory and Exchange management console.
Perform hardware and software system configuration, maintenance, upgrades, and troubleshooting of workstations, laptops, mobile devices, and printers.
Support Microsoft products such as Windows, Office, Office365, and other cloud-based applications.
Maintain cyber security practices including anti-malware, threat management, vulnerability management, and anti-phishing technologies.
Assist in the training and orientation of new staff in the use of hardware and software.
Support telephony adds, moves, and changes as required.
Provide Audio/Video Conference support for presentations and meetings.
Assist in writing technical specifications for PC configurations and maintain standards documentation.
Support development and implementation of new computer projects and new hardware installations as well as software roll-outs.
Participate in audit events as needed.

education_certification.credential: Degree in IT technology or administration (Master's preferred). Minimum 4 years of hands-on IT experience in a Microsoft Windows environment, preferably in the healthcare industry. MCSA, A+, Network+, Security+ certifications a plus. ITIL Service Management knowledge a must. Vendor or Industry Certification in a specific system or practice used by DNWest.
